chunks.cleaned_english_translation: A Scottish woman was healed from lameness there. To give some background, citizens returning from the city left behind this Scottish woman who was sick and unable to walk properly. After spending six months in that place, on the day of the annual festival held on July 6, she regained her ability to walk during the evening Psalms.
chunks.original_latin:
De muliere Scotica ibi a claudicatione sanata. 37. Sed ut huic rei gestae tempore paulo superiorem
 subjiciam, mulierem Scoticae nationis cives ab
urbe redeuntes aegram et gressu debilem ibi reliquerunt. Ea postquam sex in loco menses egit, sub die
solemnitatis annuae quae agitur pridie nonas Julii inter
vespertinos Psalmos gressus sanitatem recepit.
